model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
It's great to have friends who can help each other out, isn't it?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'apologizing', 'Related Summaries': 'Neighbors A expresses reluctance to apologize, and Neighbors B encourages apologizing as a sign of strength.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Neighbors A: I can't believe I have to apologize. I hate admitting when I'm wrong. ### Neighbors B: It's important to apologize, though. It shows that you care about the relationship. ### Neighbors A: I know, I know. But it's just so hard sometimes. I don't want to look weak. ### Neighbors B: Apologizing doesn't make you weak. It actually takes a lot of strength to admit when you're wrong and try to make it right. ### Neighbors A: I guess you're right. I just wish I didn't have to do it. ### Neighbors B: What happened? Do you want to talk about it? ### Neighbors A: I said something really insensitive to a coworker and I didn't realize how hurtful it was until they called me out on it. ### Neighbors B: That's tough. But it's good that they brought it to your attention so you can make it right. ### Neighbors A: Yeah, I know. I just don't know the best way to apologize. ### Neighbors B: Well, first you need to truly acknowledge what you did wrong and how it affected the other person. And then you can apologize and try to make it better. ### Neighbors A: That's a good point. Maybe I'll write them a letter or something. ### Neighbors B: That's a great idea. And if you need any help with it, feel free to ask me. Remember, apologizing is a sign of strength, not weakness.' }
```
